Developed by: Alisa Neeman (aneeman@cse.ucsc.edu) DomainViewer.h: Header for Wrapper class for OpenSees Domain to provide management for visualization

Member Function Documentation

void DomainViewer::setDomain ( Domain *  d  ) 

set domain and allocate scalar arrays for visualizing scalars, specifically color. Note: setting vis type is element-oriented but actual data is node-oriented

void DomainViewer::initRanges (  ) 

Allocate ColorRanges and data (color maps) Initialize data: BY_NODE_NUM, BY_ELEMENT_NUM, BY_ELEMENT_TYPE, BY_NODE_DISPLACEMENT, BY_MEAN_STRESS

void DomainViewer::drawNodes (  ) 

test function: draw nodes as LINE LOOP

int DomainViewer::updateState ( const char *  filename,
int  commitStep 
)

instatiate file channel or check for matching filename. set commit time. update Domain state. update color list(s). should we save the old domain state first? yes. allow undo.

void DomainViewer::updateRanges (  ) 

We have loaded a new state for all the finite elements. Assumption: the number and type of elements has not changed. We only need to update changed things such as displacement. We keep the color map the same. There is a seperate method to update the color map

void DomainViewer::updateStiffness (  ) 

Reset elements using new data

bool DomainViewer::setScalarColorMethodForAll ( int  colorMethod  ) 

Set the coloring technique for all elements

Returns:
whether the color method matches the current draw style, e.g. gauss color scheme for gauss points, node or element for anything else

void DomainViewer::setColorRange ( double  min,
double  max,
int  invertRange 
)

which values within 0..1 range would we like to view?

void DomainViewer::initGauss (  ) 

Calculate gauss locations and size to draw spheres once. Alllocate gauss pt color arrays (2D mixed length array)

bool DomainViewer::setMeanStress (  ) 

Calculate mean stress for every element's gauss pt set

Returns:
true if stress has occured.

void DomainViewer::setDeviatoricStress (  ) 

Calculate deviatoric stress for every element's gauss pt set

Returns:
true if stress has occured.

bool DomainViewer::setDisplacement ( double *  colors  ) 

Displacement is based on magnitude of the first 2 or 3 DOFs, depending on how many coordinates the node has. The assumption is that the first DOFs are displacement.

void DomainViewer::toggleShowElement ( int  classTag,
int  hideElement 
)

Make draw method be "Hide" but save old drawing method so you can "undo"

void DomainViewer::setBasicBounds (  ) 

Set drawing parameters for axis legends, centering pre!: Domain is set

double DomainViewer::getCenterAndMaxDim ( double  center[3]  )  [virtual]

Volume dimensions needed by VisWin for centering and scaling in window

Reimplemented from Viewer.

void DomainViewer::updateColorMap ( bool  isLogScale,
double  dataRange 
)

Update the current color map, if it is mutable. Process: 1. recalculate data (displacement. stress, etc.) 2. assign new range for color values 3. scale the data

void DomainViewer::drawCompass (  ) 

show X,Y,Z axis legend with icon in upper left corner

int DomainViewer::getNumElements (  )  [virtual]

the number of finite elements in the domain

double DomainViewer::cubeRoot ( double  val  ) 

Halley's Rational Formula for cube roots citation: G. Alefeld, "On the convergence of Halley's method", Amer. Math. Monthly, 88 (1981) 530--536. see http://www.mathpath.org/Algor/cuberoot/algor.cube.root.halley.htm

int DomainViewer::findElement ( double  loc[3]  ) 

Brute force.

Returns:
the element number or -1 if not contained in any brick
